result.execSummary:
The defendant Renwick G Spratley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after 1 year

*If revoked, all conditions of probation will become the same conditions for extended supervision 
*May transfer to another county or state

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use 
*Submit DNA sample, if not already done so

timeConds.notes:
*First 30 days in jail and balance on electronic home monitoring, if approved per jail rules
*Huber priviliges are granted pursuant to Sec 303.08(1) Stats and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department
*To be served within 90 days of probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission
from Atty Anne Renc dated 04/05/17 in re:  Notice of Completion of Representation

10:01 a.m. Defendant Renwick G Spratley in court with attorney Anne Renc. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing today. Cases 15CF460 and 16CF349 are heard today.
Prosecutor states sentencing recommendation. Prison-stayed and Probation w/conditions.
Attorney Renc for Defendant concurs with agreement stated and argues the State's jail recommendation.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
15CF460 Count 1: Possess w/Intent THC (Felony)
Imposed & Stayed: 4 yr Prison Sentence at 2 yr In & 2 yr ES, eligible for early release and substance abuse programs
Probation: 30  mo
Conditions:
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge = $518.00
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
60 days jail, first 30 in jail and balance on EM if approved per jail rules.   Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
3 day credit. To be served within 90 days of probation.
May allow transer to another county or state.
if revoked, all conditions of probation will become same conditions for ES.

16CF349:
Pay costs + DNA surcharges.

Appeal information is provided.
Sentencing hearing on April 5, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF460 and 16CF349.

1:32 p.m.  Atty Hess calls the case and states the appearances.
Court questions Anne Renc as to the where abouts of her client is.
Atty Renc indicates that he is in Minnesota and did not have any transportation to the Sentencing Hearing today.
Court questions why the sentencing could not been held prior.
Atty Renc makes statements.
Atty Hess makes statements as to his recommendations.
Atty Hess would leave it up to the Court's discretion to either issue a warrant or re-schedule the  case.
Atty Renc would not request a warrant; makes additional statements.
Court indicates that this will be the last time this sentencing hearing will be re-scheduled.
Court indicates that if the defendant fails to show up for the next sentencing hearing his bond will be forfeited. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond is ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on March 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on February 21, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF460, 16CF349
4:05 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty Constable states the appearances.  Indicates the defendant is currently at day report. 
Court questions the parties. 
4:05 p.m. Court will take a brief recess. 

4:15 p.m.  Defendant is now present with Atty Anne Renc. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF460 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
16CF349 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF460 Count 1, 16CF349.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in: 15CF460 Count 2
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
